var multimediaGallery3995 = { "props": { "defaultGallery": true, "imageWidth" : 960, "imageHeight" : 500, "pageModuleInstanceId": "3995", "moduleInstanceId": "4032", "virtualFolderPath": "/cms/lib/PA09000078/Centricity/ModuleInstance/4032/" }, "records": [ { "flexDataId": "4769", "hideTitle": "False", "title": "BizTown 5th grade field trip", "hideCaption": "False", "caption": "After months of preparing, the 5th graders took a trip to JA BizTown in York, PA. In order to prepare students learned how to balance checkbooks, write checks, and explored different career choices that were available to them at BizTown. Career options were anything from managers, TV hosts, STEM engineers, and even a Mayor that the students elected themselves. All of the students had a busy day! The comment heard most from the students, No wonder my parents are tired after working! A great time was had by all students, teachers, and community volunteers!", "imageSrc": "/cms/lib/PA09000078/Centricity/Domain/222/BizBotics.jpg", "imageWidth": "640", "imageHeight": "480", "imageAltText": "BizTown filed trip", "isLinked": "False", "linkUrl": "", "linkText": "", "openLinkInNewWindow": "False", "videoLinkText": "", "videoIsEmbedded": "False", "videoIframe": "" }, { "flexDataId": "4752", "hideTitle": "False", "title": "National History Day Competition Picture", "hideCaption": "False", "caption": "These students competed in the National History Day competition on Saturday and placed 2nd. They move onto the state competition on May 15 & 16 at Carlisle High School. Advisor: Pete Boyajian
Students: Sai Aja Bradley-Cross, Erilyn Morgan, Nick Albert, and Valeria Estrada
", "imageSrc": "/cms/lib/PA09000078/Centricity/Domain/222/National History Day Competition pic 3.jpg", "imageWidth": "1500", "imageHeight": "1125", "imageAltText": "National History Day Competition", "isLinked": "False", "linkUrl": "", "linkText": "", "openLinkInNewWindow": "False", "videoLinkText": "", "videoIsEmbedded": "False", "videoIframe": "" }, { "flexDataId": "4712", "hideTitle": "False", "title": "STEM Industry Training E-sports Club", "hideCaption": "False", "caption": "Congratulations to the students participating in our STEM Industry Training E-sports Club on its first day. The STEM Industry Training E-sports Club is an opportunity for students to understand and participate in industry-related STEM technology fields that are in high demand in the local and national area. The first 5-day after school camp is designed to teach students about computers/systems and the basic repair and maintenance of them. The next 5-day session later in the year will concentrate on teaching students how to create digital media and stream content then apply it to real-world scenarios. These camps and the club will also incorporate aspects of the very competitive and lucrative E-Sports industry. The goal is to provide students with the background knowledge in technology so they can apply it in one or more of the many STEM and E-Sports fields. The students will use their newly-acquired foundation in STEM and E-Sports to eventually have our very own E-Sports team in the coming years that can compete at local and state levels with other schools. STEM and E-Sports will allow students to learn and compete in a safe environment while also building character, meaningful-relationships, personal skills and workforce experience that prepares them for life. A special thanks goes out to Arcelor Mittal who sponsored this program through a generous grant and a special thanks to Harrisburg University who is providing help with designing the program along with staffing and training during the camps.", "imageSrc": "/cms/lib/PA09000078/Centricity/Domain/222/STEM Industry Training E-Sports Camp picture 2.jpg", "imageWidth": "1500", "imageHeight": "810", "imageAltText": "STEM Industry Training E-sports Club picture 2", "isLinked": "False", "linkUrl": "", "linkText": "", "openLinkInNewWindow": "False", "videoLinkText": "", "videoIsEmbedded": "False", "videoIframe": "" }, { "flexDataId": "4709", "hideTitle": "False", "title": "Congratulations to Naomi Pietz and Musarrat Hossain for qualifying for County Band!", "hideCaption": "False", "caption": "Congratulations to Naomi Pietz and Musarrat Hossain for qualifying for County Band!", "imageSrc": "/cms/lib/PA09000078/Centricity/Domain/222/County Band 2020.jpg", "imageWidth": "1500", "imageHeight": "1125", "imageAltText": "Congratulations to Naomi Pietz and Musarrat Hossain for qualifying for County Band!", "isLinked": "False", "linkUrl": "", "linkText": "", "openLinkInNewWindow": "False", "videoLinkText": "", "videoIsEmbedded": "False", "videoIframe": "" }, { "flexDataId": "4659", "hideTitle": "False", "title": "Operation Recognition 2019", "hideCaption": "False", "caption": "Operation Recognition 2019", "imageSrc": "/cms/lib/PA09000078/Centricity/Domain/222/Operation Recognition pic 1.JPG", "imageWidth": "1280", "imageHeight": "514", "imageAltText": "Operation Recognition 2019", "isLinked": "False", "linkUrl": "", "linkText": "", "openLinkInNewWindow": "False", "videoLinkText": "", "videoIsEmbedded": "False", "videoIframe": "" }, { "flexDataId": "4652", "hideTitle": "False", "title": "Morgan State University Visit", "hideCaption": "False", "caption": "On Tuesday, November 5, several Steel-High students visited Morgan State University in Baltimore Maryland for a college visit.", "imageSrc": "/cms/lib/PA09000078/Centricity/Domain/222/morgan 3.JPG", "imageWidth": "1500", "imageHeight": "1000", "imageAltText": "Morgan State University Visit", "isLinked": "False", "linkUrl": "", "linkText": "", "openLinkInNewWindow": "False", "videoLinkText": "", "videoIsEmbedded": "False", "videoIframe": "" }, { "flexDataId": "4638", "hideTitle": "False", "title": "Midland Cemetery Project", "hideCaption": "False", "caption": "We are pleased to announce the 3rd year of our special community partnership with the Friends of Midland Cemetery. This year 50 students from the 8th grade joined in the 3rd Annual Historic Midland Cemetery Field Experience. To conclude their History is Made Locally unit of study in their U.S. History class, students toured the Historic Midland Cemetery located just behind the School District property in Swatara Township. While there, students learned about the overall history of this historically African-American cemetery which started as early as 1795. Students learned how individuals (and the groups represented there) triumphed over the various barriers they encountered in their lives including slavery, segregation, and systemic racism. Local topics included the Hygienic School (once part of our own school district), the first teacher of that school who, himself, was born into slavery (E.L. Carey), Peter Sullivan Blackwell (editor and publisher of the Steelton Press newspaper and first black councilman of Steelton Borough), Herbert Rap Dixon (Negro League baseball star), and Andrew Askin (WWI naval serviceman lost at sea aboard the U.S.S. Cyclops). Additionally, students learned that local veterans from every major war, from the Civil War to the Korean War, have been interred within Midland.
Most importantly, none of this would be possible without local community members. We would like to extend a special thank you to Ms. Barbara Barksdale, a Steelton-Highspire alumnus herself, president of the Friends of Midland Cemetery, and a local treasure as an historian, genealogist, and preservationist. She, along with several community volunteers, including Mrs. Gilinda Cousar, Ms. Jeanie Glaser, Mrs. Elizabeth Jefferies, Mr. Ted Knorr, and Mr. William Jefferies have all been very generous with their time and commitment to the education of our students. Thanks to their care, attention, research, and service, students can begin to make connections with those who came before them, and they can see that each of us can have a role in making historylocally.
", "imageSrc": "/cms/lib/PA09000078/Centricity/Domain/222/Midland Cemetery 2019 Pic6.jpg", "imageWidth": "1210", "imageHeight": "681", "imageAltText": "Midland Cemetery Project", "isLinked": "False", "linkUrl": "", "linkText": "", "openLinkInNewWindow": "False", "videoLinkText": "", "videoIsEmbedded": "False", "videoIframe": "" }, { "flexDataId": "4630", "hideTitle": "False", "title": "Karen Devine from PSBA Presents Board Members Certificates of Appreciation", "hideCaption": "False", "caption": "Thank you Karen Devine @PSBA for presenting our school board members with certificates of appreciation. Rachel Slade (16 years) and Derek Lewis (12 years), (not pictured)Mary Carricato (12 years)have served @shsdrollers with honor and pride. Congratulations and thanks for your service!!!! #RollerNation
", "imageSrc": "/cms/lib/PA09000078/Centricity/Domain/222/Karen Devine from PSBA Presenting Certificates.jpg", "imageWidth": "680", "imageHeight": "510", "imageAltText": "cKaren Devine from PSBA Presents Board Members Certificates of Appreciation", "isLinked": "False", "linkUrl": "", "linkText": "", "openLinkInNewWindow": "False", "videoLinkText": "", "videoIsEmbedded": "False", "videoIframe": "" }, { "flexDataId": "4590", "hideTitle": "False", "title": "Chris "Handles" from Harlem Globetrotters", "hideCaption": "False", "caption": "On Wednesday, September 18th, Our Steel-High Middle School was treated to a special visit from a Harrisburg native, Chris Handles Franklin, from The Harlem Globetrotters. Chris has been all over the world, but one of his favorite things to do within his life is speak to young people about important issues such as bullying. After doing some amazing things with his basketball, Chris spoke about bullying and, through a few games involving a basketball (of course), reinforced how important it is to be respectful to everyone instead of bullying others. He also reinforced four important life concepts. They were: 1. Dont do drugs. 2. Respect your teachers, coaches, and parents. 3. Do your best in school, and 4. Believe in your dreams. We hope he can come back and share some of his wisdom about other life issues.", "imageSrc": "/cms/lib/PA09000078/Centricity/Domain/222/Handles7.jpg", "imageWidth": "640", "imageHeight": "480", "imageAltText": "Chris "Handels" from Harlem Globetrotters", "isLinked": "False", "linkUrl": "", "linkText": "", "openLinkInNewWindow": "False", "videoLinkText": "", "videoIsEmbedded": "False", "videoIframe": "" }, { "flexDataId": "4552", "hideTitle": "True", "title": "Website Hands", "hideCaption": "True", "caption": "Website Hands", "imageSrc": "/cms/lib/PA09000078/Centricity/Domain/222/websitehands.png", "imageWidth": "999", "imageHeight": "545", "imageAltText": "websitehands", "isLinked": "False", "linkUrl": "", "linkText": "", "openLinkInNewWindow": "False", "videoLinkText": "", "videoIsEmbedded": "False", "videoIframe": "" }, {}] };

span.p: Parents/Guardians: Please send an email to the following email contacts when your child is absent from school. If you have children in both buildings, please make sure to include both email contacts in order for the school to correctly document the absence(s).
Please note that if you dont have access to email, you will be expected to provide an absentee note to the attendance secretary at your childs school.

h2.a: Kindergarten Online Registration Is Now Open: Click on this link to Register Online:

span.p: Registration must be done online between now and June 26th, 2020 click on the flyer for more details.

Students Birth Certificate
Parents License or ID/ Social Security Card
Proof of Residency (Lease, Mortgage,Tax Bill )
Immunization Records
Student must be 5 years old by September 1st, 2020

h2.a: Steelton-Highspire School Districts response to the Appeal of the Highspire Education Coalition in the Commonwealth Court of Pennsylvania

a.title: Go to comments for Steelton-Highspire School Districts response to the Appeal of the Highspire Education Coalition in the Commonwealth Court of Pennsylvania
Go to comments for Taxpayer Relief Act Proposition 2019-2020-001

span.p: On November 19th, twenty-five 11th & 12th grade students attended Marauder Day at Millersville University. The day included a resource fair, breakout sessions on campus life, and a campus tour. During lunch, students asked questions of current Millersville students.

a.title: Go to comments for Marauder Day at Millersville University

span.p: On Wednesday, September 18th, Our Steel-High Middle School was treated to a special visit from a Harrisburg native, Chris Handles Franklin, from The Harlem Globetrotters. Chris has been all over the world, but one of his favorite things to do within his life is speak to young people about important issues such as bullying. After doing some amazing things with his basketball, Chris spoke about bullying and, through a few games involving a basketball (of course), reinforced how important it is to be respectful to everyone instead of bullying others. He also reinforced four important life concepts. They were: 1. Dont do drugs. 2. Respect your teachers, coaches, and parents. 3. Do your best in school, and 4. Believe in your dreams. We hope he can come back and share some of his wisdom about other life issues.

a.title: Go to comments for Junior High Anti Bullying Program Assembly

img.title: Junior Leadership Program with Mrs. Gladys Dutrieuille
img.alt: Junior Leadership Program with Mrs. Gladys Dutrieuille

span.p: In our September Junior Leadership program, all grade 7 and 8 students had the opportunity to hear two ofour local leaders who took time from their busy days to come and speak to our Jr. High School students. Our kickoff speaker was Franklin Gantz, a lifetime localeducational leader who served his community as a teacher and principal for 35 years. He spoke about his life and was honest about his successes as well as his challenges. Mr. Gantz stressed the value of real listening, being fully present, and illustrated through games, using students as participants, the difference between real listening and faking it. He gave an example of what happened to him in real life when he was not paying attention and how it changed his life forever. He also stressed the critical importance of staying in school, and how growing in education can changelives.

Mrs. Gladys Dutrieuille is the current PA Chair of the Public Utility Commission who also came to Steel-High Jr. High School to speak to students about the vocational opportunities available in the utilities field. We learned there is a great need for skilled workers in this field. She also spoke about opportunities in the legal field which was an interest of our students. She answered scenario andgeneralquestionsfrom our students about her knowledge as a lawyer. She told them about her personal journey to her currentprestigious position in our local government as chair of the public utilities commissionand spoke about what she believes will propel people into increasing positions of responsibility. EDUCATION! RESPECT! These are some of the keys to success, she said.
We thank all participants of the Junior Leadership Program for sharing their stories and their wisdom with us!

a.title: Go to comments for September Junior Leadership Program

h4.span: The Steelton-Highspire School District is partnering with Perform Care to implement the Guiding Good Choices Program. This program is delivered in five sessions and is designed for parents who have children ages 9-14. The program will be facilitated by other district parents. We are currently looking for parents who are interested in being facilitators. Facilitators will be paid for training and for facilitating sessions. If you are interested in being a parent facilitator, please contact Travis Waters at twaters@shsd.k12.pa.us or 717-704-3800 option 4.

a.title: Go to comments for SHSD and Perform Care Good Choices Program- Parent Facilitators Needed

Thank you to all of our community partners including the United Way, Dauphin County Children and Youth, Swatara Township Police Department, State Representative Patty Kim, Capital Blue, Penn State Childrens Hospital, Contact to Care, the Central PA Food Bank, the Early Resource Learning Center, and all the organizations that helped to make this event a success.","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"Kindergarten Resource Fair 5.11.2019 pic 11","src":"Kindergarten Resource Fair 5.11.2019 pic 11.JPG?rnd=0.708581823254275","caption":"In conjunction with the United Ways Ready Learn Ready to Succeed initiative, the Steelton-Highspire School District held a successful kindergarten registration, school readiness, and resource fair. Thank you to all of our community partners including the United Way, Dauphin County Children and Youth, Swatara Township Police Department, State Representative Patty Kim, Capital Blue, Penn State Childrens Hospital, Contact to Care, the Central PA Food Bank, the Early Resource Learning Center, and all the organizations that helped to make this event a success.","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"Kindergarten Resource Fair 5.11.2019 pic 10","src":"Kindergarten Resource Fair 5.11.2019 pic 10.JPG?rnd=0.787141785857799","caption":"In conjunction with the United Ways Ready Learn Ready to Succeed initiative, the Steelton-Highspire School District held a successful kindergarten registration, school readiness, and resource fair. Thank you to all of our community partners including the United Way, Dauphin County Children and Youth, Swatara Township Police Department, State Representative Patty Kim, Capital Blue, Penn State Childrens Hospital, Contact to Care, the Central PA Food Bank, the Early Resource Learning Center, and all the organizations that helped to make this event a success.","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"SHSD Band Performance at Mall May 15 2019 pic 2","src":"SHSD Band Performance at Mall May 15 2019 pic 2.jpg?rnd=0.155326762308984","caption":"The Steelton-Highspire Elementary Band performed at the Harrisburg Mall Food Court, May 15.","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"Career Pathways 5.9.2019 pic 5","src":"Career Pathways 5.9.2019 pic 5.JPG?rnd=0.435764222143108","caption":"On May 9, 2019, the 7th and 8th grade students participated in a career pathways program entitled Dream it, Be it, which was sponsored by Soroptomist International and The Salvation Army. \ \ Through education and access to role models, the program aims to empower to pursue career goals and reach their full potential. At this event, our students learned about career opportunities, setting and achieving goals, overcoming obstacles to success, and moving forward after setbacks. \ \ The Steelton-Highspire School District would like to thank both the Soroptomist International and the Salvation Army for sponsoring this amazing event. \ \ ","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"Girls on the run 5.11.2019 Pic 6","src":"Girls on the run 5.11.2019 Pic 6.jpg?rnd=0.450958872889615","caption":"Girls on the run 5.11.2019","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"Bridge Dedication","src":"Bridge Dedication Pic 6.jpg?rnd=0.895161866627243","caption":"On May 2nd, 2019, students from the Steelton-Highspire Elementary School Color Guard participated in a bridge dedication ceremony with State Representative Patty Kim to honor Vietnam Veteran SPC. Fourth Class Reuben Louis Garnett Jr who grew up in Steelton. SPC. Mr. Garnetts family recently accepted his diploma from the Steelton Highspire School District through the Operation Recognition Diploma Program.","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"Literacy Event","src":"literacy 2.JPG?rnd=0.506874315211025","caption":"On Wednesday May 1, 5th grade students from the Steelton-Highpsire Elementary School participated at an event sponsored by the Capital Region Literacy Council held at the Midtown Scholar Bookstore. The students read poems from a book they read in class titled Crossover written by Kwame Alexander. At the event, Steelton-Highspire Elementary School 5th grade teacher Mrs. Simone Heisey and Steel-high graduate and current County Commissioner the Honorable George Hartwick were honored for their dedication and promotion of literacy. ","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"Steel-Highs Journalism Class","src":"ABC 27 2.JPG?rnd=0.569937492986181","caption":"Steel-Highs Journalism Class tours ABC 27 and observes a news broadcast","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"PeaceBeatCircleStudentHands","src":"PeaceBeatCircleStudentHands.JPG?rnd=0.322550476213242","caption":"","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"SHSD Trash Day Pic 10","src":"SHSD Trash Day Pic 10.JPG?rnd=0.538241940335483","caption":"Steelton-Highspire Students and staff participated in the #TrashTag Challenge on April 16, 2019","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"SHSD Trash Day Pic 25","src":"SHSD Trash Day Pic 25.JPG?rnd=0.428447612295136","caption":"Steelton-Highspire Students and staff participated in the #TrashTag Challenge on April 16, 2019","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"7th Grade Science Students Fresh Water Pond Biome","src":"7th Grade Science Students Fresh Water Pond Biome.jpg?rnd=0.474855388270158","caption":"7th Grade Science Students Studying Fresh Water Pond Biome","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"Harrisburg Promise STEM Field Trip to iFly Indoor Skydiving","src":"Harrisburg Promise Bus.jpg?rnd=0.348352299699724","caption":"Steelton-Highspire students in the Harrisburg Promise program learned firsthand about science,\ technology, engineering and math (STEM) during a field trip on Dec. 20, 2018.\ The 44 students were given flight training at iFly Indoor Skydiving in King of Prussia,\ Pennsylvania. Then each student, accompanied by trained skydivers, suited up in flight gear to\ experience velocity in a state-of-the-art wind tunnel. STEM educators also guided them through\ an interactive presentation, demonstrations and lab activities.\ This once-in-a-lifetime opportunity was funded by donations to the HACC Foundations\ Harrisburg Promise Fund for Excellence. For more information about Harrisburg Promise at\ HACC, Central Pennsylvanias Community College, please visit hacc.edu/HarrisburgPromise.","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"Steelton-Highspire School District Girls on the PA House Floor With Patty Kim","src":"Steelton-Highspire School District Girls on the PA House Floor With Patty Kim.jpg?rnd=0.401470849943101","caption":"Eight students from the Steelton-Highspire high school were selected to participate, with students from 3 other local schools, in a Girls on the Hill event at the capitol building in Harrisburg. It was a day of advocacy and empowerment for women to pursue careers in STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics) fields, hosted by Harrisburg University.","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"Former Student Kayana Chisolm Playing for Albright College Pic 2","src":"Former Student Kayana Chisolm Playing for Albright College Pic 2.jpg?rnd=0.362598462664801","caption":"Former Student Kayana Chisolm Playing for Albright College","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"SHSD Chess Club Pic 1","src":"SHSD Chess Club Pic 1.jpg?rnd=0.681767505911071","caption":"SHSD Chess Club Picture","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"SHSD Chess Club Pic 7","src":"SHSD Chess Club Pic 7.jpg?rnd=0.438029390963739","caption":"SHSD Chess Club Picture","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"Grief Day Nov 2018 Pic 8","src":"Grief Day Nov 2018 Pic 8.JPEG?rnd=0.169824609612033","caption":"On Thursday November 15, 2018 the staff and students at Steel-High celebrated Childrens Grief Awareness Day during the high school lunch periods. Childrens Grief Awareness Day was created by the Highmark Caring place in 2008. Childrens Grief Awareness day is an opportunity for staff to support students through their grief. Students were given an opportunity to create a Hope butterfly to honor and remember the lives of loved one lost.","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"Grief Day Nov 2018 Pic 4","src":"Grief Day Nov 2018 Pic 4.JPEG?rnd=0.624013147141791","caption":"On Thursday November 15, 2018 the staff and students at Steel-High celebrated Childrens Grief Awareness Day during the high school lunch periods. Childrens Grief Awareness Day was created by the Highmark Caring place in 2008. Childrens Grief Awareness day is an opportunity for staff to support students through their grief. Students were given an opportunity to create a Hope butterfly to honor and remember the lives of loved one lost.","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"Grief Day Nov 2018 Pic 1","src":"Grief Day Nov 2018 Pic 1.JPEG?rnd=0.623042460355462","caption":"On Thursday November 15, 2018 the staff and students at Steel-High celebrated Childrens Grief Awareness Day during the high school lunch periods. Childrens Grief Awareness Day was created by the Highmark Caring place in 2008. Childrens Grief Awareness day is an opportunity for staff to support students through their grief. Students were given an opportunity to create a Hope butterfly to honor and remember the lives of loved one lost.","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"Veterans Day Ceremony 11.9.2018 with Patty Kim Picture 5","src":"Veterans Day Ceremony 11.9.2018 with Patty Kim Picture 5.jpg?rnd=0.912869635463166","caption":"","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"Doughnuts for Dads Sept 2018 pic 1","src":"Doughnuts for Dads Sept 2018 pic 1.jpg?rnd=0.530854240307051","caption":"","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"Doughnuts for Dads Sept 2018 pic 9","src":"Doughnuts for Dads Sept 2018 pic 9.jpg?rnd=0.900115251028964","caption":"","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"Steelton-Highspire 1st Day of School Pic 1","src":"Steelton-Highspire 1st Day of School Pic 1.jpeg?rnd=0.827714925085993","caption":"","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"Steelton-Highspire 1st Day of School Pic 11","src":"Steelton-Highspire 1st Day of School Pic 11.jpeg?rnd=0.356284265572338","caption":"","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"Hershy Master Chocolate Maker Jim St. John visits the SHSD greenhouse","src":"Hershy Master Chocolate Maker Jim St. John visits the SHSD greenhouse.jpg?rnd=0.378601334234048","caption":"My first grade students were able to take a trip to our districts aquaponics greenhouse today. My students had a great time exploring the greenhouse and learning all about how the plants grow. We got a chance to meet a real-life chocolate maker who encouraged my students to continue to learn and be scientists throughout their lives. We cant wait to go back next year! ","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"Aquaponics Gardening","src":"Aquaponics 1.JPG?rnd=0.450451947492758","caption":"","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"Aquaponics Gardening","src":"Aquaponics 6.JPG?rnd=0.335730447124564","caption":"","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"Backpack Program","src":"Backpack Program Image 2.jpg?rnd=0.897738191251521","caption":"The BackPack Program is designed to meet the hunger needs of these children at times when school resources are not available, such as weekends and school vacations. Through this program, children can fill backpacks with nonperishable and vitamin fortified foods to take home on weekends. Through 38 partners the Central Pennsylvania Food Bank serves more than 5,700 children through the BackPack Program. There are currently 74 BackPack distribution sites in central PA.","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"Google Earth Picture of Steelton Highspire School District 7.25.2016","src":"Google Earth Picture of Steelton Highspire School District 7.25.2016.jpg?rnd=0.888016976829626","caption":"","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"},{"photoname":"Roller Country","src":"roller country.jpg?rnd=0.929837733940146","caption":"","pause":"","link":"","target":"_self"}]}}
